result.reason: Major new feature requiring native SSH library integration or deep PuTTY automation; mRemoteNG delegates SSH to external PuTTY process making auto key provisioning out of scope for current architecture
result.approach: Would require native SSH key generation (OpenSSH libs), password-authenticated session to deploy pubkey to remote authorized_keys, and secure private key storage — architectural change beyond current fork scope

attempts.raw_output:
Based on the issue details - this is a feature request to automatically generate SSH key pairs and deploy public keys to remote servers (like SmarTTY does). Currently mRemoteNG delegates SSH entirely to PuTTY as an external process, so this would require either native SSH integration or significant PuTTY automation. Upstream maintainer comments confirm this is a large-scope change not currently prioritized.
